Review:
Â We stayed at the Radisson Blu last night, being post lockdown we were still required to use masks in the breakfast room this morning which the hotel supplied along with hand sanitiser 
There were also stations with masks and sanitiser in the reception area 
Social distancing prompts throughout the hotel were being followed by staff and guests alike 
Beautiful breakfast was excellent value for money 
The property was very clean and comfortable very welcoming after traveling in to the city 
Only downside was the AC wasnâ€™t very cool so rather hot and uncomfortable overnight 
Trouser press didnâ€™t work which really wasnâ€™t a problem and the bar that held the shower head came off as I tried to adjust it, meaning we could use the shower this morning but there was a lovely deep/wide bath so also not a big problem 
We reported it to reception and the said they we get this repaired straight away 
Definitely would stay again

Review: Â Check in was fast, and easy. Receptionist was informative and very helpful. Myself, and partner ate food and enjoyed some drinks at the â€œWhite Barâ€ situated in the lobby area, food was very nice, expensive but it was good. The facilities were great, the gym was spacious and had a good variety of machines, didnâ€™t manage to use the spa. But, both were complimentary with a nights stay. We ordered breakfast to our room at no extra charge, after paying at reception for it, the price was around Â£20 for us both. We ordered for 9am, and it was delivered bang on the time. The food was hot and nice, we received extras including croissants, fruit, orange juice and toast with a variety of sauces and jams. Although, we had both ordered coffees and this didnâ€™t come with our breakfast. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and stay.

Review:
Â The breakfast wasn't worth the money. Too many muesli style cereals, and the scrambled egg was AWFUL. It was very pale so there was obviously too much milk in it and it was sticky and heavy. It was served everyday except one, and surely the amount of scrambled egg being left uneaten on plates tells you something?? I asked for a fried egg, and that was OK, but if there was any chance of a cooked to order omlette, I didn't see the sign. There wasn't much fresh fruit, and it was mostly the same. Finally, I know coffee machines are a labour-saving device, but for the cost of the breakfast and the star rating of the hotel, It was not OK to be using a coffee machine, similar to one I saw the other day in Kwik-Fit!!
I've had better breakfasts with more variety in 3* hotels in Egypt and Greece. Start taking breakfast seriously, pull your socks up.

Review: Â I have stayed here previously and had a lovely stay and this time was no exception. The staff are always lovely and approachable in the hotel, restaurant and in the spa area. Me and my partner did not book a table at the restaurant, and even though they were quite busy the staff done what they good to get us seat, to which we were very grateful. One of my favourite things about stay here is the comfort of the rooms, especially the beds. Warning: if you plan on staying up late to do work, stay far away from the bed because once the the blackout curtains are closed and you get slightly comfy on the bed I guarantee you will be out like a light. Check out time being 12pm is brilliant as it gives you that little extra time in the comfy beds. Will be staying again when I have an excuse.

As requested, all the rooms had river views, large comfy beds, free toiletries and tea/coffee etc. Within the hotel itself you felt very secure and the hotel is just a short walk from the Liverpool One shopping area and the Pier Head. We used taxis that were waiting outside the hotel and the fares were very reasonable. We all had breakfast about 8 a.m. which was very good quality. The staff were very friendly when checking in. Following checking out, the hotel allowed us to leave our bags at the hotel as we were not leaving Liverpool until the evening.

Had we have gone by car, parking appeared to be extremely limited, although there is a secure car park in the same st, for a cost. Booked a superior room, which was both clean & comfortable and actually exceeded my expectations. Breakfast on both days was excellent, varied, well cooked, presented & hot. Staff were extremely helpful, polite & friendly. I would definitely stay again and wouldnâ€™t hesitate in recommending this hotel to friends or family.

Review:
Â The staff was fantastic and their standard of service excellent. The location is very good (Moorsfields station has a direct access until 7pm from the hotel's street) if you need to connect with Merseyrail. Otherwise, the hotel is within a short distance to Lime St Station, shopping area and main sightseeing landmarks. If you use Uber, it is cheap and quick if you travel in a group.
Access to swimming pool and gym was a plus.
Regardless of the things I didn't like, the hotel is a good choice when getting a discount offer for your stay as we did in our group. Wifi was excellent. This 'dislikes' shouldn't put anyone off when deciding to stay on this hotel.

Title: Exceptional

Review:
Â Used the hotel as we was guests at a wedding in the hotel.
Asked to check in early as had two babies with me I was advised could check in early and to ask for the lady (Deena) when I arrived. So I arrived with a suitcase, crib, bag with bottle preps and tow babies in two to be told I could no longer check in early. And if I wanted to they could downgrade me which would cost more money but smaller bed which was a no as we had a bigger bed for a reason with 4 of us in a room.!!! Went back 4/5 times to ask about check in and was told to come back in 10/15 minutes each time! This was very stressful as they was fully aware the wedding was starting at 12 in their hotel and I had all my luggage with me plus the two babies! . Eventually the wedding started and we only got to check in exactly at the check in time! Was very unhelpful! 
The room once got in it was old and worn and smelt like it had been cleaned by a damp cloth all over!! 
Not a superior room as advertised. Nothing different to the standard room a family member was staying in. 100% wouldnâ€™t stay here. Staff where rude and in the evening bar staff where snappy and didnâ€™t seem like they wanted to be there!

Title: Relaxing

Review: Â We upgraded to a suite & thought this would guarantee a lovely room but on arrival we couldn't have been more disappointed. The room looked dated like something from the 1970s, the wood work on the furniture was chipped and damaged, the paintwork was scuffed and skirting boards were scuffed. Bathrooms grout had black mould. I rang downstairs to ask if this was the upgraded room & was told it was & that the only other room available to move to was a standard room - which god what would that have been like. This was our first weekend away from our special needs adopted daughter in 6 years & we had wanted it to be a room we could relax & recharge in but it was upsetting instead. The staff on the Saturday sent prosecco & cake up to the room to apologise & said that the hotel was due a refurb but tbh we didn't even touch the bubbles, it couldn't fix a weekend we soo needed for restbite that had now been ruined.

Title: A waste of 3 days that could have been more happily spent somewhere else!

Review: Â The staff were delightful and very helpful, and the facilities were excellent, especially the spa. It was perfectly situated near central Liverpool, with dramatic views of the Mersey. I had a luxurious room, which was large with a great view of the Mersey and a lovely big bathroom with very good toiletries. The hotel was of a beautiful design, with a breath-taking central lobby. The food, drink and choice for breakfast was excellent. The restaurant had a great ambience and design, with the food and service of a high standard. This hotel could be 5 star! I could not recommend it highly enough.

Review:
Â Absolute total disgrace.  Room was dirty, bed was not made.  Quality of bedding and pillows very bad.  Your receptionist Dean came up to see the room and commented how bad it was, taken us to another room not much better.  Booked a superior room and got no slippers or robes, tea and coffee was not replaced on the second day. Breakfast was very poor quality ingredients, when you could get them.  You had to wait on cutlery and cups, at one stage we were told to use paper cups as they had no clean one.  On Sunday there was no bread and the chef came out to say if you can wait 9 minutes I could get some????? Hello youâ€™re a hotel.  Ditch your scrambled eggs, disgusting.  Have the staff not told you how many plates go back with it on it because it is so bad.  Still waiting on Dean or someone (I think her name was Dina) to get back to us over a week later.  Not a happy customer.  Definitely not 4 star.  
 Picture is of the bed in the first room, when we arrived. The second room was much the same

Title: Bar closed early, breakfast weak

Review: Â Upon arrival of the property, there was a strange odour within the lobby area that myself and partner both noticed and said. We stayed on the fifth floor and there was also a strong smell of paint right a long the corridor, the paint smell canâ€™t be helped obviously and there was plenty of signs to indicate what was still wet etc, but the smell in the lobby wasnâ€™t the best start - wasnâ€™t unbearable but wasnâ€™t pleasant either. Our room was okay, it seemed quite dated and was clean enough. One of our bathroom lights was broke and flicked constantly when switched on, the tube needs replaced (room 508 - floor 5). Our bed was very low to the ground, and slanted. It felt as though I was a lot higher up than my partner, but I think this reason was because it was two king beds that had been pushed together to create the double. The pillows, and quilts were both comfortable and warm though. In the morning after what was an okay sleep we went to make a coffee each, when we had a look at the tea and coffee condiments there was a handful of different teas, plenty of sugar and sweetener but only one sachet of coffee, I donâ€™t know if this was a mistake or the normality but was a problem for us as we both enjoy a coffee in the morning, what made it worse was that we had also ordered two with our breakfasts in the morning to the room, and it turned up without any coffee, and instead just orange juice which we didnâ€™t order. Check out was fine and again pleasant, and we are certain that if we raised the issue with a member of staff they would have been kind enough to sort our demands. It wasnâ€™t the best stay but canâ€™t fault the staff, I just think I have for sure stayed in better Radissonâ€™s elsewhere in different cities than this one and they have perhaps set a higher standard than this particular establishment.

Review: Â After a 5 hour drive from wales to Liverpool for a funeral, I arrived at this hotels reception to be told that the room the I had booked and paid for upfront was not available. I had booked a premium room with river view and obviously a double bed for me and my wife , only to be told by staff on arrival that they can only offer us a standard room with single beds and no view . I expressed that this was not good enough and I had already paid for the room , just to be told that the best they could do was push the beds together for us . No apology !  At this point it was 12:30 am and me and the wife were far to tired to argue , so we agreed and went up to the room . The following morning I confronted staff about my concerns only to be told the rooms are no different and just offered a complimentary free breakfast during our stay ðŸ˜‚. The hotel itself is of a good standard, but staff working there most definitely need better training when it comes to customer service. Me and the wife will not be using their hotels again .

Â My bed wasnâ€™t ready even though we checked in 3 hours later than check in time. 
I asked for the bed to be changed while we were out and this wasnâ€™t done which meant I had to sleep in a twin bed which meant me and my partner basically had a single bed for Valentineâ€™s Day of all days so I was far from happy.
They did comp breakfast for us and knock 20 pound off the bill to be fair but I would have preferred the issues never occurred in the first place.
I also didnâ€™t like the fact that there was no clear way to contact reception via the telephone. I had to ask at reception what number to ring but youâ€™d think it would be on the phone or in the room, also there wasnâ€™t a hair dryer so we had to request one to be brought up.
They upgraded us to a business room with the promise of bottled water as a gesture of good will for the messing about but the water never arrived, we had to request it from reception and even then it was warm when it came.
We stayed at this hotel last year for Valentineâ€™s and the experience was a lot better last time. I wonâ€™t be booking again next year if Iâ€™m honest.

Review: Â Nowhere at the time of booking, or in my non refundable booking confirmation email did it state that the credit card that was used for payment, would need to be presented at the time of check in.  I made this booking from Melbourne, Australia and this was a Christmas gift for my parents who live in Liverpool, England.  I noted that it would not be me who would be checking in, and gave the booking contact name and details.  When my parents attempted to check in, there were told that they had to pay for the room as they didn't have my credit card.  They were hit with a $311.61 (1 hundred and 72 pound) bill!!  My parents called me immediately and I spoke with Dinah on reception who was rude and unhelpful and passed the blame to Booking.com for not providing the hotel payment policy correct information.  I was told to call back on Monday (the booking was for a Saturday) and that I would need to speak with the hotel accounts team.  Since my booking was non refundable, even if my parents refused to stay, I would have still been charged!!  My Mum paid the $311.61 on her credit card and they continued with their planned hotel stay.  They had a really nice time, but the whole trip was tainted by the first encounter and the worry that they had to foot a very expensive hotel stay, when they only lived 40 minutes out of the city!  I called the accounts team as advised by Dinah on Monday and spoke to a really helpful lady called Natalia who apologized for the incident, processed a refund on Mums card and confirmed that the payment would be taken from my card, as originally planned.  The whole incident was very stressful and took the excitement, fun, and Christmas cheer away from the fact that this was supposed to be a Christmas present - it cut into my parents spending money and they spent the rest of the day/night being very careful with what they spent just incase the refund request was declined on the Monday when I was advised to call.

Review: Â The valet service - I was told to call 30 mins before I wanted my car and it would be brought round. I did this, and was called back after 20 mins and told there was no driver to bring my car round. I would have to be walked over to their secure parking facility to retrieve my car myself.  I was a bit miffed as this was done without any apologies for the inconvenience. I mentioned it at check out and was told the maximum discount they could offer was Â£5. The approach of the person was all wrong. A simple apology and offer to take Â£5 off the parking bill would have sufficed, rather than saying "the max discount I can offer is Â£5". This is especially because I only said "it would be nice to apologise for the inconvenience or at least offer something for the inconvenience. I did pay for a valet service that I am not receiving in its entirety".  It's simply good customer service and I didn't receive it. Instead, I felt a bit insulted! To make matters worse, I didn't have a coat and it was freezing outside and I had to walk to this facility whilst shivering!

Title: We found the open plan nature of the hotel was not conducive to a good night's sleep! Too noisy!

Review: Â The room information was erroneous in that it said there was a fridge, but the policy has changed and all the fridges have been decommissioned. The front desk staff are happy to put things in a small fridge but you have to keep going up and down for that. There is a small ice bucket in the room with ice stations on each landing. Not anything like as good as having a fridge in the room though (we'd had plans for keeping some picnic-type stuff in the fridge and had to abandon that idea.)  The TVs were not working properly while we were there and this was a total hotel problem (except for the bar area) and the technicians were having trouble putting it right. We feel it was too expensive for what was on offer, although that is just a personal view. (Having said that, it you make good use of the pool and gym you are recouping a bit of the expense!) The restaurant was probably a bit on the dear side (but then so are a lot of eating places around the centre - we checked some of them out in passing). Finally, some might find it a little further away from the centre and main part of the waterfront than desired (incl. the river cruise start point opposite the Liver Building which is 12 mins' walk away, also the hop-on hop-off bus start points, and the Museum of Liverpool. The National Trust minibus tour of the Beatles Houses starts from Jury's Inn which is 25 mins' brisk walk away near Albert Dock, and the John Lewis area of shops would be about 20 mins. The cathedrals would probably be about 25 - 30 minutes' walk - bit less coming back as you are going downhill!)  - so check out the position to be sure, before booking. As it happened we didn't mind at all once we'd got our bearings, and we walked miles all over Liverpool (felt like it anyway!) and it was quite convenient to get back to. Otherwise it is not hard to get a taxi.
Title: We enjoyed staying here in spite of any negative points I have made, and Liverpool is a great city!

Review: Â The covid restrictions  had quite a large impact. The usual coffee cups  were not in the room but were replaced by one paper cup each and limited coffee sachets . Also  unless requested they would not change the towels or clean the room, which is ok for one night but 3 - very flat atmosphere  the bar was very open plan not too inviting.  I totally understood the restrictions but I felt that there could have been other ways of making it more invitingi.e. paper cups , soft music in reception, perhaps paper print outs of the local area,maps etc for people to take away so they did not have to ask staff.   However it was warm, clean and a great location.

There was a generator outside our bedroom window so we didn't sleep at all this was ment to be an enjoyable time as my girlfriends a care assistant and worked all of covid19 but was spoilt by our very poor room 
We actually looked at other hotels to move to that day but unfortunately they were fully booked 
Why pay full price for a stay when only half the services are available

Review:
Â i booked this stay to celebrate my fiancee birthday and our engagement in one. we arrived at 12 and had got told we cant check in till 2pm, which was fine as we were early so we decided to go into Liverpool as it was our first time here, we then came back and got told to wait over an hour again for our room as it weren't ready again,,, so we asked if we could go swimming, baring in mind half of the day had already nearly been gone. we came back from swimming at 15:45 on purpose to allow the hotel to prepare for our room. we then came in to a very large queue, i went to the front and said you already have our details so can we just have our key please and was told the systems had gone down and had to wait just over half an hour again in the queue. no drinks were offered out of good will or apologies. this is poor customer service and because this was a special occasion im even more annoyed this was the experience we got in Liverpool for the first time. 
so we entered our room once the day had pretty much gone, and seen that there were petals on the bed which was amazing yet i got told prior to booking this hotel that no one is allowed to enter the room to decorate for our special occasion because of covid, yet someone was allowed to put petals on the bed where we sleep?
im really just not happy and would prefer our money back. we had little time in the hotel and the experience was ruined from the moment we arrived.

Iâ€™m pointing all this not expecting to be recompensed for this â€œunexcited experienceâ€, I just believe all this missed details can be fixed and leave an amazing impact on your customers otherwise your staff (at the reception and in the morning at the restaurant at the breakfast  - I interacted only with them) were very friendly and helpful and is sad to see your staff hard work and delivering good customer service and to loose customers for such important details that somehow been neglected.

Valerii.

Review: Â our friends were given a  twin room instead of a double despite the fact they upgraded their room, this was quickly rectified for them and they weren't charged the upgrade. However when we entered our room we were disgusted to find a pair of dirty knickers right in the middle of the floor of the room!!!!!! Immediately rang reception who arranged for someone to remove them but it was obvious that the room hasn't been cleaned properly at all!!!! absolutely disgusting that a chain of hotels of this calibre do not ensure the rooms are thoroughly cleaned after each use!! I dread to think what else they didn't clean! and to add insult to injury we were still charged the extra 30 for the room upgrade!!!! We had a room with a view but to be honest i struggled to look past the black mould around the windows!Also went for breakfast which was equally disgusting....watery scrambled egg, no fresh Orange, no cups for the coffee only paper ones and i had to ask twice for some cutlery to eat the breakfast as there wasn't any on our table!!! The lifts also broke on the sat night. definitely wouldn't recommend.
Title: Cleanliness is definitely not your forteit!

Review:
Â The location the car park is far too far away..... 
The changing rooms in the spa was very dirty I shook my towel and dust flew into the air which showed me it hadn't been cleaned for a long time..... 
The door stop was smashed off in our room... But put back in as if it was fine..... One of the lift wasn't working but for the amount of people staying there was usually quite a wait..... 
The shaver plate was upside down and didn't work so I couldn't charge my shaver...... There was a hole in the wall near the window that was covered by the curtains....

I always thought if radisson blu as a really nice and thought of hotel that if you spend that extra few quid for a nice place to stay. if I knew it was gonna be like that I woulda just saved my money and stayed in the Dolby across the road

What is it that is difficult to understand about a quiet room and the need for a good night's sleep. Put you in rooms opposite the lift or by these types of doors !! ?.  Do they know their own hotel or is it that you dont care.  And this cost almost 100 per night.

It was but it is awful. To call it a Spa is rude. The hot tub was COLD and small max 3 person or 4. Water sat all over the floor, the walls are in a terrible state of repair. The pool area was not pleasant. Changing rooms smelt, lockers but no keys. Overall this hotel is very run down and needs to be modernised. I would never stay here again.

Â The reception area, restaurant and lounge area are lovely. The room we stayed in (308) was tired, we had booked a twin room for my friends birthday. We were given a double. We were emailed about getting an early check-in and a late check-out. Both were not given to us. Response was they had sold out of these. Don't know why they were offered when neither could be accommodated. Disappointed, as it was clearly stated when we made the booking it was for my friends birthday........The pool facilities are very poor. The pics make it look far better. The pool is cold, old and tired. The sauna is good, but the steam room is luke warm, plus its up-stairs (we found it as we wete leaving). The pool and sauna is accessed via a very un-health and safety spiral staircase. 
We were phoned twice in the morning, then they hung up? This was before our check-out time of midday. The cleaner tried to get in, again before our midday check-out. Finally, we were recommend The Capital carpark by the hotel - absolute nightmare getting out and is not a 4min walk as advised. More like 15mins, doesn't seem much, but seems an eternity when taking your luggage to the car. Hope this helps someone ðŸ˜Š

Title: A Good hotel but below expectations.

Review: Â I'd thought that I'd pre booked breakfast when I booked the room, but it turned out that I hadn't. The receptionist was pretty snotty with me when I asked for a couple of minutes to double check my emails to ensure that I hadn't booked breakfast, and didn't end up paying again.  She was just desperate to charge us an extortionate amount rather than wait for me to check.  In hindsight I wish I hadn't have purchased breakfast anyway as it wasn't great.  Undercooked bacon, overcooked tomatoes and hash browns.... empty fruit selections.  I should have saved my money and found another establishment to have breakfast.  Location was further out of the city centre than I had hoped, and it was a nightmare to get to and from.  View of docks from our room (specifically booked a river view)  blocked by building works over the road.  Bathroom needed some attention...wasn't spotless as I'd assume, and once housekeeping had been done on our second day, only half of the tiles had been replenished. I lost count of the amount of times I tripped on the small step into the bathroom.  Re; the bed, an additional blanket would have been nice, half the duvet inside didn't fill the duvet cover, and we ended up with just cover either side of the duvet. . I wouldn't book this location again.

The staff on the bar at night werenâ€™t particularly helpful. In the rooms there is an abundance of coffee but only 2 teabags available!

Review: Â Only problem was for me personally the beds were a bit on the soft side, by my 3rd morning I struggled to stand up.
Title: Exceptional

Review: Â The rooms were very dated, with no plugs anywhere near the bed.  This is my pet hate in the 21st century!!  The air conditioning was poor and very noisy.  The facilities in the room were very basic, the mini-bar/fridge had been removed and there was no complementary water.  There were no additional pillows and when we requested some from reception they failed to turn up.  The hotel is based in a largely business area that is being heavily renovated so there are few restaurants, bars or other facilities nearby.  The road outside the hotel was closed due to construction and the nearest car-park was supposed to be 5 mins walk away but was more like 10.  The breakfast was a very basic buffet which was all self-service including coffee and toast so was more like a Service Station than a Radisson Blu.  The restaurant seating was a very odd design with tables of two sat almost next to each other.  The two coffee machines produced individual cups at a very, very slow rate, individually grinding each cup.  Jugs of coffee served by waiting staff would be far more efficient and a much better service to customers.  There were only scrambled eggs on the buffet and no additional options presented, the hash browns were anaemic and it was like a treasure hunt to find small plates for the cold food.  All in all a disappointing experience when compared to other hotels in the chain that we've stayed at.
Title: Disappointing for a Radisson Blu - over-priced.

Review:
Â We ordered room service using their app system, I went downstairs to check how to pay, as we hadn't left them card details. They checked the order and arranged to bring a card machine up, though I also drew cash just in case.
After nearly 2 hours I enquired when the food would arrive, they phoned 10 mins later and told me they hadn't received the order, and could sort it in 20 mins.
The food was okay, expensive for what it was, and there was a Â£4 service charge included. If we do stay with Radisson Blu again, we'll be ordering from outside the hotel, as we were considering just going out for food by the time it arrived.

The cleaner is very poor we had to ask everyday for a clean in our room this should be done like ir states on the website we was there for 4 days come third day it was thick with dust setting my asthma off i had to ask for the cleaner to dust around for me and u have to ask for a complimentry tea and coffee for your room or they dont give u one i as a hotelier know that this should be done once per day. One of the rooms did not have any shower gel, just shampoo and conditioner. the same room did not have working AC and the maintenance guy offered me a fan instead, after he tried to fix (the dial was broken). I will not stay here again and do not recommend it to anyone!

Title: Felt let down.  Expensive hotel and never a four star

Review:
Â We arrived early and we knew we would have to wait until 3pm - this was discussed and acknowledged by us up front.  However, the reception staff kept advising that it MIGHT be available earlier, so we kept hanging at the hotel, being a tad travel weary.  It would have been better to have been told that the room was definitely not available until 3pm - and not raise our expectations.  Staff at reception were unfriendly and not usefully informative.   The experience did not get better from there.  The restaurant is easily the worst one we have experienced in our travels to date (4 weeks) around Europe and UK.  Rubbery and tasteless  food on the hot plates eg: scrambled eggs sitting in their own whey three breakfasts running; the best items being the sausages, bacon and tomatoes, which were at best, tepid; coffee not pleasant, sticky tables, One evening meal not available at 8.30pm on a Saturday as had run out of food - only Room Service available (?);  Fridges in room "being decommissioned", so no cold water;  all the glassware etc available ..   Here is the list we gave to Reception and left in the room as well :  Poor toilet flushing;  airconditioning unit very loud.  9 floors up, so if you turn it off, the room is too stuffy to sleep;  chair at table very unstable, looked as if it might implode when someone sat on it;  shower support loose- did not hold shower head upright or firmly;  shower door seal leaks creating a very wet floor - could slip.
See our other reviews - we very rarely have occasion to be negative.  This room, this weekend was frightful - perhaps they can do better - certainly other Radissons do.

When I upgraded the room, as it was a very special anniversary, I was offered this complimentary and informed that the Che would prepare a VIP  "Welcome Platter -this was not forthcoming, despite asking twice!   Our firstt eening at the hotel was disturbeduntil 3.45 am by the wedding guest screaming and shouting, banging doors and generally conversing in he corridors.
The room was supposed to be an Executive room, bed was comfy but each evening we had to requst extra milk and sugar via the Reception.  Perhap these should be supplied in more quantity as not everyone wants to  go up and down in the lift, to collect these items, after sightseeing in Liverpool all day.  On the Sunday evening we had room service, food was excellent, hot and plentiful, well worth the tray service charge.
I have joined your Radisson Rewards programme and would like to have the cost of the of our evening meal Â£43.00 added to our Rewarrds Card please, the number is 6015 9958 1419 9236.

The breakfast was like something you would get at a service station. When asking for things like beans and then jam we were just told â€˜there isnâ€™t any. None at allâ€™. This was one hour before the breakfasts finished. 
The overall look in the foyer area was nice but really thatâ€™s where it stops. We have stayed in Liverpool on numerous occasions but hotels like the Hilton, Pullmanâ€™s and Malmaison are a much cleaner and better options. Title: Good hotel, bit of a walk to go anywhere, service terrible

Review:
Â The Premium room with River view (611) is quite shabby with quite a few bits of damage, one of the reading lights is intermittent, the desk lamp does not work at all. the marble desk surface has a crack all the way across it.
The TV seems only to have 5 analogue channels and the controller is intermittent.
There are no biscuits and the mini bar has nothing in it (staff advised all room fridges had been decommissioned)
The drawers have no sides so clothing falls out. 
We have already had to make a trip to reception because both the room cards stopped working. My wife got stranded in the fitness centre vestibule because the key card did not work.
We were told free lockers were available in the fitness centre, however when we got there we were told a Â£1 coin is needed to rent padlocks (the attendant did lend us 2 free when we told him we had no change).
The male toilet light was faulty.
The spa area is quite shabby with various damage and areas of bare plaster, we did not feel the area was very hygienic. The changing rooms are poorly furnished with no costume dryers, unspecified product, no obvious moisturiser or conditioner.
I raised these items with staff, they responded positively, offered a room upgrade and free breakfast. I declined the room upgrade as I didn't want to move clothing etc. for 1 night in a better room.

Title: Disappointing

Review:
Â So first impressions of this hotel were very good, the location of the hotel is pretty good too, I requested a room with a view of the river outside and the hotel provided this.
The main lobby is very modern and clean with access into the restaurant and bar area, the check in area was a little busy but only took a few minutes to clear.
This is where we get to the bad bit... The room, from the description on the website was meant to be a really nice room.. I was visiting for birthday celebrations so naturally chose what I thought would be a nice hotel. Upon entering the room, we noted how dated the room was looking and that it was not modern to the same standard as the main lobby area.
The bed was actually quite comfortable and we had a sitting chair and a table chair along with pen, paper and a phone. The website advertised a free bottle of water in your room, this was not provided. We also wasn't informed that the mini bars in the room had been deactivated so there was no supplied stock and no where to store any chilled items we may have brought with us. The TV was a bit of a let down, it had just over 10 standard definition aerial channels, if you were lying on your bed and was trying to watch one of the channels, you would struggle due to the poor picture quality. By the windows (last couple of pictures) we have clear evidence of mold and this was one of the biggest let downs of a radisson blu hotel, I expected this to be a non-existent problem in a 4 star hotel.. How this hotel is still 4 star baffles me.
The bathroom was quite modern with a nice sink, but again we had issues with mold being around the bath and shower area. On our first night we noticed that the adjustable shower head was broken so we couldn't change the setting and the temperature was either artic or desert (freezing cold, boiling hot), there was no Inbetween.
Probably the nicest part was the downstairs spa and fitness area.

Review:
Â When we arrived we were allocated the Wong room type - we had paid extra for the deluxe river view - we were told at first that the hotel was full and we couldnâ€™t have what we paid for. Some argument and a long wait later and we got what we paid for. 
There was only one small pillow each in the room and no robes or slippers for the spa (as advertised). We asked nicely and were told that the hotel was too full for more than one pillow each (4 star hotel ?!?!) and that we simply could not have robes. Another heated call and a wait and they appeared also. Okay so we got them but at a 4 star hotel you should not have to ask and if you do ask you should not have to complain.
The pastries and rolls at breakfast were stale and had obviously been carried over from Saturday.
When it came time to leave they made a complete mess of the taxi booking. We asked for a taxi at the required time and gave almost 2 hours notice. A taxi arrived but would not take us without a code from reception and reception had either lost or did not know about the code. So we were late to the station.
For 400 quid for 2 nights you should get better. 
Absolute shambles.

Title: Not up to 4star standard.

Review: Â Paid Â£224.00 on a Sunday night for what was described as fantastic prior booking with great facilities etc etc. Well I was appalled at this hotel, firstly I paid Â£224 on a Sunday night, for the best room you could get (advertised as the best on booking.com) and it was no better than a travel lodge room worth Â£25, there was no windows that opened, there was a mini bar fridge with nothing in it and was turned off an had mold all in it so we couldnâ€™t even put our own drinks in. The room was terrible it said we would have a river view hence the higher price, when really we had a steamed up window which over looked a building site. We was on the 5th floor and seen not even half the river due to cranes etc so we felt ripped off as we was in a less than standard room!! We then come to check out on Sunday and the lifts were broke so after waiting 15 minutes for a lift that never come we tried to find stairs down, well what a surprise we found stairs which took us to the basement and there was no way out, we had to walk half way back up and then walk to the lifts on another floor to get down. Â£224 is a small holiday for someone, we decided to splash out an go for the room that would make it special and it was abysmal, well over priced and I will never stay here again, not even so much as a complimentary bottle of water for Â£224.

Title: Liverpool great wished I'd visited sooner

Review:
Â No hotel information folder. There was no info in the room on the spa services or hotel services with prices. Not enough  tea/coffee in room. We personally drink a lot of tea/coffee and had to ring down a couple times. 
No info on the little capsules to know what they are as there was no names on them. So that was disappointing. As first time visitors to Liverpool the hotel was great.
Title: Our Trip

Review:
Â We booked the hotel as we were specifically looking for a 4* experience, in particular the gym, spa and pool facilities. Extremely disappointed as the steam room was out of action the entire time and the gym was closed for 2/4 days. Other areas that fell below expectation:
- lovely bar with cocktail menu: at least half of cocktails not available due to bar no longer stocking ingredients
- inadequate heating in room: despite being on max, the temperature of one of our rooms was very cool 
- toilets didn't flush properly in either room, sink was blocked in one
- fridge not working in either room
- televisions not working for the first day and intermittent fault over the next couple of days: husband had planned to stay in and watch Grand Prix, this was not possible
Staff were very friendly and tried to help, but the facilities were definitely not the 4* we were expecting, more like 2*. Won't be booking into a Radisson again.
Title: Disappointing

Review: Â Tv had no reception, room was dreary and dated
Title: Disappointing

Review:
Â This hotel is a disgrace, and not like any other Radisson I have stayed at. It is filthy and understaffed . The dirt in our hotel room. The balls of dust behind the bed. The broken lights in our room. The damp in our bathroom. The dirt in the bathroom. The room service tray left outside our neighbours door with remains of breakfast which was left there for 24 hours. The hotel was filthy and run down. I paid the price of a 5 star hotel and the experience was akin to something out of Faulty Towers. The two bar staff ladies who were rude, aggressive and didnt bother to serve anyone food or drinks as they were complaining about how overworked they were. A spilled drink remained on the bar / cafe floor for a good hour before anyone cleaned it up. The bar was not busy as it was early afternoon, so there was no excuse for the lack of service and the rudeness.The fact that the Reception staff seemed to be familiar with these two girls and their attitude and apologised to residents on their behalf as if they were well used to them. The man at the pool reception who said he could not give me slippers as they were running low. When I told him our room had only been stocked with one pair he made me leave the swimming pool reception and go and find housekeeping to get a pair. This took me 20 minutes while my partner waited in the pool for me.
The hotel was filthy and the service a shambles. There is also a big hole in the wall on the stairs down to the pool. This hotel would fail any health and safety test were it examined.

Review: Â Very short staff which resulted in us not getting the treatment that we payed for. We spend a lot of money in the hotel for terrible service. The first night after being up since 2am that morning we decided to have a early night and get some room service. We ordered 4 meals and only 3 came.. but they came sepreate, first all the chips came and a salad with no cutlery then 20 mins later the rest of the fish came by that time the chips were cold and we were missing a meal also and still no cutlery so no way of eating the food?? The second day we made the mistake again to order some room service for lunch. We ordered and after 30 mins waiting we ended up walking down ourselves. When we got down we were told by one of the staff that the food had be sitting there ready... like it's room service for a reason, then we got a chicken salad that was full of fish which resulted in us not eating it.. I've never written a review before but I felt the need to this time as we saved up so hard to come here for my mams 50th birthday. We were left disappointed and still waiting on the manager to get back to us just so disappointing.

Review: Â Location - too far away from main attractions. Bedroom was tired and dated, despite the fact that I had been upgraded to a Business class room.  No frills at all such as cushions, throws, pillow choices or nice decor which was disappointing as I paid a LOT of money for what was supposed to be a luxury weekend there.  Prices were high (more than double the normal rate) as it was a busy weekend in Liverpool but the hotel did not pay for any extra staff to deal with full capacity.  TV reception in bedroom was very poor and was never able to get BBC1 at all, mini fridge didn't work, wardrobe handles were loose. Breakfast was chaos - not enough staff, no cutlery, tables and serving areas a mess and ran out of several items of food and condiments. Spent the whole weekend gutted at the amount of money I paid to stay there. At the time of booking I had the choice of many cheaper hotels but chose this one for what I thought would be luxury. BIG mistake. I complained to the hotel at the time but they said they couldn't help as I'd booked through Booking.com. I complained to Booking.com, they e mailed the hotel but the hotel didn't bother to reply!  I will NEVER stay in a Radisson Blu hotel again. Utter disgrace.

Title: Very disappointing-next time we ll stay at the Crowne Plaza.

Review: Â There were 3 dealbreakers unfortunately which kind of ruined our stay.The worst one was that unlike other hotels we have stayed in, there were no charging points/ sockets anywhere near the 2 bedsidw units which I found bizarre.so no using your phonr/ tablet/ laptop lying in bed whilst its charging.this was very inconvenient and quite frankly strange for a business room.secondly one of specific reasons we chose that hotel over other 4 star hotels was the mini fridge in the room as my hubby is addicted to his fizzydrinks.unfortunately the fridge didnt work and we were told all the room fridges had been decommisioned! Despite this thry still advertise the room fridges.I had to throw away all our fruit which wrnt off overnight.heard other guests complain about this too.And the breakfast was very disappointing.We have always had lovely meat free breakfasts at other hotels.here despite the mention of fried eggs and scrambled, there were only scrambled on offer which were undercooked and runny.absolutely disgusting taste.there were no vegetarian/ quorn sausages available and no pastries/ croissants/ large cookies available as in other hotels with that rating.All this with a serving time only till 10.30 and no actual serving from staff who looked annoyed that most people choose not to have breakfast at 6 to convenience them.Add this to the heavily expensive parking available (26 pounds per day!) , very expensive massages at the spa and non working lifts, no spare pillows in rooms and no gowns/ slippers offered in spa.at nearly 300 for 2 nights we wish we had stayed in a budget hotel like premier inn or travelodge which were closer to the centre and had cheaper parking and better views.Not a patch on other similar rated hotels so avoid if you wany good value for money

Review:
Â The hotel cleaning staff were rude & just done the basic clean. Our coffee cups were left on the desk for 2 days. There was a wedding on the hotel & the confetti etc was just left all over the floor until that night. The lift took forever to reach each floor & think only 1 was working.
Although check-in is 3pm, we arrived at 830am. We were told to come back at 230 & might get a room. We done so but we were informed nothing was available. What upset us was the fact others were checking in & getting their rooms even though they were staying in the same type of room.only that we complained the lady at the check in desk used her inititive & swamped our room with someone who hadnt arrived yet!! This could have been done earlier. Bad start to our stay. Maybe hire more housekeeping staff!!!

Title: Enjoyable city break

Review:
Â The restaurant was atrocious. 
The first morning of our stay I asked for milk, got a rude point from the waitress to say it was in the table........ 
The same waitress the 2nd morning couldnâ€™t top up the coffee machine, so I ended up having tea as she poured the wrong coffee into the machine! 
Dinner in the evening was a disaster, husband asked for steak medium, it was more well done. I asked for rare lamb, it came out well done. Needless to say it was sent back to the kitchen. 15 minutes later the head waiter who was the bar manager came over and said the chef had told him it was rare...... then he added that there was no more lamb, so did I want something else! My husband had by this time eaten his meal, and to be honest I had gone off eating by then....,,, you never know what happens in kitchens when someone sends something back!
Title: The worst restaurant we have been in!

At check in wasn't told any details of breakfast or that valet parking was available, so I ended up paying more at the NCP.

The Hotel entrance was difficult to locate . Why do these large buildings not have a sign indicating where the entrance is to avoid pedestrians with luggage having to struggle  round from the main road to find a way in,!
